Returns: a string representation of the object.
toString().Description: Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read. It is recommended that all subclasses override this method. The toString method for class Object returns a string consisting of the name of the class of which the object is an instance, the at-sign character `@', and the unsigned hexadecimal representation of the hash code of the object. In other words, this method returns a string equal to the value of:

Returns: the name of this route category
Parameters: Context: Context to resolve name resources
getName(android.content.Context).Description: Return the properly localized/configuration dependent name of this RouteCategory.

Returns: Flag set describing the route types supported by this category
A list with the routes in this category that have been added to the MediaRouter.
Parameters: List: a List to fill with the routes in this category. If this parameter is non-null, it will be cleared, filled with the current routes with this category, and returned. If this parameter is null, a new List will be allocated to report the category's current routes.
getRoutes(java.util.List<android.media.M.Description: Return the current list of routes in this category that have been added to the MediaRouter. This list will not include routes that are nested within RouteGroups. A RouteGroup is treated as a single route within its category.

isGroupable().Description: Return whether or not this category supports grouping. If this method returns true, all routes obtained from this category via calls to @B_android#media#MediaRouter#getRouteAt_E@ will be @B_android#media#MediaRouter#RouteGroup_E@s.

Returns: the name of this route category

ClassDesc: Definition of a category of routes. All routes belong to a category.
